column5: That muskie is awesome!!! Congrats that must have been exciting!
2 Fish, 1 Guy?  Very nice fish, indeed!

Thanks for the nice comments. The whole muskie thing is so thrilling. Even if you LOSE that big one it's still "almost" as good as holding it up. I only recently started casting for them more when I used to only troll.Hearing that reel scream is like Mozart to others but getting them like that is real cool.Lucky for me she was big.Depending on where you fish ( I happen to have it good where I live ) any one that bites could be that fish that you talk about forever.
SWEET fish!! Congrats on the PB's!
Wow, awesome muskie!!  And to get her casting on the F8 no less.  Congrats!!
Wow!!  I was excited for you just reading that!!  Congrats on that mammoth of a Muskie and an amazing walleye
WOW! That is a musky fisherman dream come true. You are blessed to fish some great waters nearby.

While fishing with a board member this Sept I experienced a thrill few ever will. I was fishing the St Lawrence and casting for muskies. The conditions were perfect for fishing,light winds and overcast skies with sunny breaks. I had been casting a drop off that has been known to hold a fish or two but action was a bit slow. I was reminded by my partner that fish in this area have a tendency to show up last second so focus was important from when the bait hits the water to the second it comes out. Moving your eyes from the bait coming in could result in heartbreak at any time. After a few hours and many MANY casts things just happened in slow motion. Bait was coming in to the boat and it was a half second from being out of the water for the next cast when The Queen showed up with her mouth on the bait right by my feet. Had I not been focused I might not even have seen her. The rod loaded up with weight. The fight was on and I had to follow this fish around the boat many times until she swam in the net. I have a few big ones to my credit, a few low 30's, a couple of 35's and a 38 lber but they all came trolling.She taped at 53 x a lot and cradle weighed at 42 lbs. This moment was quite special from hook up to release and it may never be beat. And then a few weeks ago I was also fishing the river for smallies and on my very first cast of the day I felt weight,good weight.Not smallie kind of weight. Good headshakes with a few runs resulted in my PB walleye at just under 10 lbs. Gotta love Fall fishing. As always, pics to follow.
Fish of a lifetime-congrats!
Couple of fantastic fish darsky, specially that big musky and congrats on the pair of PB's. Looking forward to the pictures.
Oh Man !!! I could feel the excitement in your words. Musta been  rush, and a real pleasure !!!   Paul
Well done
well done congrats on the PB'S !!!!  thats a brute of a musky....cheers
Yeah, nice job--can't wait for the porn, get them posted brother!!

That was a great read, looking forward to the pictures (especially the big one that struck at boatside!)What a rush that must have been. Trolling fish make just as nice a photo, but catching them on the cast can't be beat!
Wow, sounds like a real thrill.  Two gorgeous Fish Darren
A coupla beauties there for sure, Darren. I'm sure you had a great time.
Great lookin fish there Darren, muskie is in perfect shape and very peerty
Awesome catches!!! You know it's big when you need to "bear-hug" it to take a picture!!! Congrats!
Man - that Musky is HUGE !!!!   Congrats.
WOW!!!!That's all I gotta say about that!
wiping considerable drool from face   :]
Nice Muskie! Sure looks longer than 52" !  Board member eh? Is he in hiding?
Dude:  I asked for porn but that is freakin sick!!
Great fishes and great stories to go with them. Good work, you earned 'em
Beauty fish! Bad hat!
That ski is a beast, and that walleye looks like it would be a good snack for it.
Excellent Darsky   Congrats on your PB's
Shaaaaahweeet Darsky.  Beasts man.  Congrats on some greats.
What a beast!  Congrats on the dule PBS!
Thats a huge 'ski darsky! Awesome markings too. Congrats on landing such a beast!!!    Oh, and the wally is alright as well...
